text:
I have upgraded tomcat from 4.0.2 to 4.0.3 on 2 separate servers using the rpm 
packages. One server is running RedHat 7.2, the other RedHat 7.0. After the 
upgrade, the error message "Error unable to create jar cache in /tmp 
directory : java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file" appeared 
several times for each web application in catalina.out.

I have been unable to locate information in the documentation that shows where 
tmp is configured. The start-up scripts installed by the rpm create an 
environment variable for temporary data, but this is set to [$tomcat_home]/temp 
not /tmp.
creator: bgsmith01@fs.fed.us
remm@apache.org
text:
This has been fixed already.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 6400 ***

creator: batbdotcom@yahoo.com
text:
Tried this with 4.0.4 on WinNT with IBM's 1.3.0 (20020124 build) and still get 
these errors. catalina.bat is setting java.io.tmpdir correctly.

creator: remm@apache.org
text:
You need to have a temp directory for Tomcat to work. This is a user issue;
please do not reopen this report.
